author: Brian Eckhouse, Doug Alexander, Josh Wingrove
description: The Trump administration blocked United States Steel Corp.’s plan to stop production at a plant in Illinois, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, a move highlighting the federal government’s continued influence over an iconic American firm after approving its takeover by Japan-based Nippon Steel Corp.
title: Trump Blocked US Steel From Stopping Work at Plant, WSJ Says

author: Andrew Kreighbaum
description: After focusing on immigration enforcement and boosting deportations for much of his second term, US President Donald Trump is expected to push new measures upending the H-1B visa program, a cornerstone of the employment-based immigration system that allows US companies to hire college-educated foreign workers for specialized occupations. He plans to sign a proclamation requiring a new $100,000 fee to petition for H-1B workers and asserting that abuse of the program has displaced US workers, acco
title: Why Trump Wants to Charge $100,000 for H-1B Visas

author: Carmen Arroyo, Kurt Wagner
description: Sales at Elon Musk’s X dropped slightly during the second quarter from the first quarter, signaling that the social network has struggled to build on the spending that rushed in when Musk was at the center of US politics.
title: Musk’s X Shows Weaker Sales After Initial Post-Election Surge

author: Josh Wingrove, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump expressed support for Union Pacific Corp.’s proposed $72 billion acquisition of rival Norfolk Southern Corp., which is seeking regulatory approval.
title: Trump Offers Support for Union Pacific, Norfolk Southern Deal

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: President Donald Trump defended his Federal Communications Commission chair against criticism, including from Republican Senator Ted Cruz, over his threats to the ABC broadcast network, which have spurred concern about free speech rights.
title: Trump Calls FCC Chair a ‘Patriot,’ Disagrees With Cruz Criticism

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Shruti Srivastava
description: The US has sought to bring India’s oil purchases from Russia into negotiations on a trade deal, people familiar with the matter said, even as the South Asian nation’s refiners ramp up those imports to meet rising domestic demand.
title: US Seeks to Include India’s Russian Oil Purchases in Trade Talks

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump’s administration has launched a website for a visa program for the wealthy, a much-anticipated effort to encourage the rich to immigrate to the US by offering residency permits for hefty price tag.
title: Trump Unveils Gold, Platinum Visas Costing Up to $5 Million

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday, White House correspondent Hadriana Lowenkron delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Gets Closer to a Signed, Sealed, Delivered TikTok Deal

author: Josh Wingrove, Erik Wasson
description: President Donald Trump predicted that a US government shutdown is likely, citing a stalemate between his party and Democrats.
title: Trump Predicts Government Could ‘Very Well’ Shut Down Oct. 1

author: Eliyahu Kamisher, Andrew Oxford, Keith Laing
description: California will not backfill a $7,500 federal tax credit for buyers of electric vehicles that is set to expire this month, Governor Gavin Newsom said on Friday, reversing an earlier pledge to restart the state’s own EV subsidies.
title: California Won’t Replace Expiring $7,500 Federal EV Tax Credit

author: William Horobin
description: France’s credit rating was downgraded for the second time in a week, underscoring a deterioration in the outlook for its public finances amid a prolonged political crisis.
title: France Rating Downgraded Again as Concerns on Finances Mount

author: Chris Palmeri, Kelcee Griffis
description: A gathering storm over late-night TV comedy has given local station owners a chance to curry favor with the Republican-controlled Federal Communications Commission, which must ultimately bless any of their merger plans and approve deregulation they’re seeking.
title: Local TV Station Owners Have Reason to Back FCC Chair on Kimmel

author: Chris Strohm
description: Trump administration officials have told the top federal prosecutor for the Eastern District of Virginia that he will be removed from his position, after his office didn’t bring charges against New York Attorney General Letitia James for mortgage fraud, according to two people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Officials Removing US Attorney Over James Probe

author: Erik Wasson
description: The Senate confirmed Mike Waltz as US ambassador to the United Nations, giving the former national security adviser a new home months after he was booted from President Donald Trump’s inner circle after inadvertently adding a journalist to a sensitive Signal group chat.
title: Waltz Confirmed as UN Ambassador Days Before Annual Gathering

author: Gerry Smith, Jessica Nix
description: A panel of new vaccine advisers picked by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. voted Friday to end the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention’s universal recommendation that people of all ages get Covid shots, moving the decision from individuals to one made in coordination with medical professionals instead.
title: CDC Panel Ends Universal Covid Vaccine Recommendation

author: Thomas Buckley
description: Since returning to lead Walt Disney Co. in 2022, Chief Executive Officer Bob Iger has tried to steer clear of the culture wars.
title: Kimmel Embroils Disney’s Iger in Culture Wars He Tried to Avoid

author: Miranda Davis
description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement officers fired tear gas at a crowd of protesters outside a suburban Chicago detention center, intensifying tensions as President Donald Trump pushes to escalate immigration enforcement in US cities.
title: ICE Uses Tear Gas in Clashes With Protesters in Chicago Suburb

author: Lauren Dezenski
description: The US is in talks with the Afghan government about returning military forces to Bagram air base, according to a report in the Wall Street Journal, a day after President Donald Trump said he was seeking to regain control of the facility.
title: US in Talks With Taliban to Return Forces to Bagram, WSJ Reports

author: Janet Lorin
description: Harvard University said Friday it has received $46 million in federal research funding, part of the more than $2 billion the Trump administration froze after allegations the school didn’t adequately move to curb antisemitism on campus.
title: Harvard Receives $46 Million in Restored Federal Research Money

author: Aashna Shah
description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy called out the Chicago Transit Authority and Massachusetts Bay Transportation Authority to take action and accountability for crime happening to transit workers and riders.
title: Duffy Calls Out Chicago, Boston to Take Action on Transit Safety

author: Liam Knox, Janet Lorin, Josh Wingrove
description: The Trump administration accused Harvard University of refusing to comply with a civil rights investigation and alleged that the nation’s richest college is falling into a position of financial instability, according to two separate letters from the Education Department.
title: Harvard Accused by Trump Administration of Financial Instability

author: Emily Birnbaum, Steven T. Dennis
description: Senator Ted Cruz has become the most prominent Republican to criticize Federal Communications Commission Chair Brendan Carr, saying President Donald Trump’s top media regulator resorted to “mafioso” behavior to pressure Disney Corp.’s ABC to remove late night host Jimmy Kimmel.
title: Ted Cruz Blasts FCC Chair’s ‘Mafioso’ Tactic to Sideline Kimmel

author: Nick Wadhams
description: President Donald Trump said he’ll meet Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Washington next week to discuss the sale of Boeing Co. aircraft as well as efforts to resolve a dispute over F-35 stealth fighters that soured ties between the NATO allies.
title: Trump Will Meet Turkey’s Erdogan to Discuss F-35 Jet Dispute

author: Josh Wingrove, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump is expected to sign a proclamation as soon as Friday that would move to extensively overhaul the H-1B visa program, requiring a $100,000 fee for applications in a bid to curb overuse, according to a White House official familiar with the matter.
title: Trump to Add New $100,000 Fee for H-1B Visas in Latest Crackdown

author: Donato Paolo Mancini, Samuel Stolton
description: Italy’s long-delayed plan for a landmark €13.5 billion ($15.9 billion) bridge linking Sicily to the mainland is facing scrutiny from the European Union, with regulators pressing the government for more information on the project’s environmental impact.
title: EU Queries Italy’s Sicily Bridge Plan Over Environmental Issues

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: President Donald Trump’s administration has repeatedly threatened to use its power over broadcast TV licenses to police disfavored speech. Most recently, Federal Communications Commission Chairman Brendan Carr invoked the threat after late night show host Jimmy Kimmel accused Trump supporters of trying to use the murder of conservative activist Charlie Kirk to “score political points.”
title: Can Trump Pull TV Licenses Over Political Speech? How FCC’s Powers Loomed Over Kimmel Affair

author: Nicola M White
description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission is dropping its 16-year-old case against an executive convicted of aiding R. Allen Stanford’s $7 billion Ponzi scheme after former President Joe Biden cut short his prison term.
title: SEC Ditches Allen Stanford Controller Case After Biden Reprieve

author: Erik Wasson
description: Congress moved closer to an Oct. 1 government shutdown as Senate Democrats and Republicans on Friday each blocked the other party’s rival plans to provide temporary funding.
title: US Lurches Toward Shutdown as Senate Democrats Block GOP Stopgap

author: David Gura, Magdalena Del Valle
description: The UN is preparing emergency measures to slash global peacekeeping operations if funding doesn’t come through, Secretary-General Antonio Guterres said, weeks after the US announced it was clawing back tens of millions of dollars in payments.
title: UN Preparing Major Cuts in Peacekeeping If Needed, Guterres Says

author: Nancy Cook
description: For a White House that likes to celebrate its business acumen and smart hires, President Donald Trump’s administration has a striking number of key economic jobs unfilled right now.
title: Trump’s Economy Team Is Short Some Key Players Amid Staff Churn

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: Anna Gomez, the lone Democrat on the US Federal Communications Commission, said President Donald Trump wouldn’t legally be able to make good on threats to pull TV station licenses over content he doesn’t like.
title: FCC’s Gomez Says Trump Can’t Revoke TV Station Licenses

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A US judge in Florida for now tossed out President Donald Trump’s $15 billion defamation lawsuit against the New York Times days after it was filed, finding the president’s lawyers failed to follow court rules requiring “short, plain, direct” claims.
title: Trump’s NYT Lawsuit Tossed for Now as ‘Inexcusably’ Long

author: Nicolle Yapur, Ignacio Olivera Doll, Matthew Burgess
description: A run on the peso is forcing Argentina to burn through its hard-currency reserves and tighten its grip on markets as an accelerating investor exodus threatens to derail President Javier Milei’s stabilization plan and throw the economy back into crisis once again.
title: Milei Defends Peso to ‘Last Dollar’ as Devaluation Jitters Mount

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Democratic lawmakers ratcheted up their criticism of Federal Communications Commission Chair Brendan Carr after he successfully pressured Walt Disney Co.’s ABC network to pull late-night host Jimmy Kimmel’s show this week.
title: Democrats Escalate FCC Chair Scrutiny Over Kimmel Suspension

author: Josh Wingrove, Kate Sullivan
description: US President Donald Trump said he had made progress with Chinese President Xi Jinping toward finalizing a deal over TikTok and that the two would meet on the sidelines of the upcoming Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit, after a highly anticipated call between the two leaders on Friday.
title: Trump Touts Progress With Xi on TikTok, Will Meet Him at APEC

author: Erik Wasson
description: The House passed a stopgap spending bill to avoid an Oct. 1 US government shutdown, setting up a showdown in the Senate later Friday, when Democrats are expected to block the legislation over demands to bolster health-care spending.
title: House Passes GOP Funding Bill, Sets Up Senate Shutdown Showdown

author: Aaron Eglitis, Ott Tammik
description: Three Russian fighter jets violated Estonia’s airspace in what the Baltic country called an unprecedented violation, an incident that triggered fresh NATO consultations and prompted accusations that Moscow is growing more brazen in testing the alliance.
title: Estonia Seeks NATO Discussion After Russia Breaches Airspace

author: Zoe Tillman, Greg Stohr
description: Chief Justice John Roberts has asked for a response from Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook by Sept. 25 on President Donald Trump’s bid to immediately remove her from office, deferring acting on his request for now.
title: Supreme Court Doesn’t Immediately Act on Trump Bid to Fire Cook

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: The Treasury Department on Friday released its proposal regarding tax relief on tips, one of Donald Trump’s key promises in the 2024 campaign, including new prohibitions against tips collected in connection with “illegal activity, prostitution services, or pornographic activity.”
title: Treasury’s No-Tax-on-Tips Proposal Excludes ‘Illegal Activity’

author: Alberto Nardelli, Ewa Krukowska
description: The European Union proposed a complete ban on imports of Russian liquefied natural gas from Jan. 1, 2027, as part of its latest measures to curb President Vladimir Putin’s ability to wage Moscow’s war against Ukraine.
title: EU Proposes Full Ban on Russian LNG From 2027, a Year Early

author: William Wilkes
description: Daimler Truck Holding AG and General Dynamics Land Systems Inc. are expanding their partnership on military vehicles to capture more contracts as defense spending climbs worldwide.
title: Daimler Truck, General Dynamics Expand Military Partnership

author: Candido Mendes
description: Angola is unlikely to raise fuel prices while the government evaluates the impact of subsidy cuts earlier in the year that sparked deadly street protests.
title: Angola Rules Out More Fuel Price Increases After Deadly Strikes

author: Eyk Henning
description: The Dutch government has decided to sell a stake in the German unit of state-owned grid operator Tennet Holding BV through a private placement, people with knowledge of the matter said.
title: Dutch Government Is Said to Decide on Tennet Germany Stake Sale

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan could soon see its first female prime minister, with Sanae Takaichi emerging among the front runners in the ruling Liberal Democratic Party’s leadership race, a significant achievement in a country where women leaders remain a rarity.
title: Japan May See Its First Female PM Despite Limited Progress on Gender Gap

author: Jenni Marsh
description: Talks today between the US and Chinese leaders are expected to lead to an in-person summit as early as next month.
title: Trump-Xi Phone Call Is Round One of a Far Larger Fight

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo’s prime minister reinforced his campaign to dismantle Serbian-run health and education services in majority-Serb areas, defying US and European Union warnings to avoid unilateral moves that risk inflaming tensions.
title: Kosovo’s Premier Stokes Tensions in Ban on Serb-Run Services

author: Arno Schuetze, Karin Matussek
description: Bayerische Versorgungskammer, the German pension fund that funneled hundreds of millions of euros into US properties tied to embattled developer Michael Shvo and his company SHVO Capital, is facing fresh scrutiny over the deals by local lawmakers.
title: German Pension BVK Faces Fresh Scrutiny Over Shvo Investments

author: Ewa Krukowska, Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union is considering measures to accelerate the bloc’s phaseout of Russian liquefied natural gas a year earlier than planned, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: EU Mulls Phasing Out Russian LNG a Year Earlier Than Planned

author: Alister Bull
description: South Africa expressed cautious optimism over progress in trade talks with the US, a month after President Donald Trump slapped the nation with 30% tariffs on its exports.
title: South Africa Hails ‘Constructive’ US Trade Negotiations

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni and her officials are waiting for credit assessors to recognize their efforts to shrink one of the world’s biggest debt mountains.
title: Meloni Looks to Fitch and Rivals to Mark Italy’s Fiscal Comeback

author: Soo-Hyang Choi, Shinhye Kang
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung will meet BlackRock Inc.’s Chief Executive Officer Larry Fink in New York next week to discuss topics including artificial intelligence and energy, his top aide said.
title: South Korea’s Lee to Meet BlackRock CEO to Discuss AI, Energy

author: Oliver Crook, Craig Stirling, Daniel Basteiro
description: Spanish Economy Minister Carlos Cuerpo defended his country’s China diplomacy, arguing that it’s all conducted in tandem with the European Union and doesn’t risk relations with the US.
title: Spain’s China Diplomacy Defended by Cuerpo as Tackling Trade Gap

author: Grace Sihombing, Claire Jiao
description: Less than a year since taking office in October 2024, Indonesia’s President Prabowo Subianto has doubled down on ambitious plans to remake Southeast Asia’s biggest economy. This comes despite policy changes earlier this year that spooked investors and sent the rupiah to levels not seen since the 1997-1998 Asian crisis, when the country needed a global bailout.
title: Why Indonesia’s Sweeping Overhaul Is Spooking Markets

author: Patrick Donahue
description: Russian forces struggling to gain ground in Ukraine are sending troops and supplies through empty gas pipelines in order to evade deadly drone strikes.
title: Russian Troops Creep Through Empty Gas Pipes to Hide From Drones

author: Charlotte Hughes-Morgan
description: On a chilly day this February, Dutch Crown Princess Amalia smashed a champagne bottle against the hull of the combat support ship Den Helder as dignitaries — including executives from the shipbuilder, Damen Shipyards NV — cheered the christening.
title: Crisis at NATO Shipbuilder Unsettles Europe’s Defense Plans

author: Oliver Crook, Jorge Valero, Daniel Basteiro
description: The European Union should consider all possibilities to utilize billions of euros of frozen Russian assets to help fund Ukraine, according to Dutch Finance Minister Eelco Heinen.
title: EU Should Keep All Options Open on Russian Assets, Heinen Says

author: Alastair Gale, Erica Yokoyama
description: Sanae Takaichi, one of the leading candidates to become the next head of Japan’s ruling party, said Friday she would roll out tax benefits and make cash payouts to households if she wins the party’s Oct. 4 leadership election.
title: Takaichi Touts Tax Cuts, Cash Payouts in Japan Ruling Party Race

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: The reformist party that won Thailand’s last election is seeking a comeback by targeting populist and conservative strongholds ahead of an expected vote, even as its pact to back rival Anutin Charnvirakul for prime minister risks eroding support.
title: Reformist Thai Party Targets Thaksin Stronghold in Comeback Bid

author: Galit Altstein
description: With the war in Gaza intensifying and little to no sign of a ceasefire, Israel’s economy and businesses are bracing for further strain.
title: Israel’s Long War in Gaza and Mass Call Ups Strain High-Tech Economy

author: Hannah Miller, Kelcee Griffis
description: Late night comics continued on familiar terrain Thursday as they hosted their first shows after ABC suspended Jimmy Kimmel’s program over comments he made about the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Late Night Comics Praise Kimmel, Offer Plenty of Trump Jokes

author: Rakesh Sharma, Clara Ferreira Marques
description: Indian refiners have no plans to step away from Russian crude as domestic fuel demand picks up after the monsoon season, even as New Delhi resumes trade negotiations with Washington and both sides press for a deal.
title: India Presses Ahead With Russian Oil Buying as Modi, Trump Talk

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: China slammed the US for blocking a United Nations Security Council resolution calling for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, signaling Beijing’s frustration with the system just as it seeks to reshape global governance.
title: China’s UN Envoy Accuses US of ‘Abusing’ Veto Power Over Gaza

author: Oliver Crook, Marton Eder
description: The European Union is inching toward issuing joint debt to help fund investments needed to improve its economy, according to Austria’s finance minister.
title: Austria’s Finance Minister Sees Gradual Path to Joint EU Debt

author: Toru Fujioka
description: The Bank of Japan left its benchmark interest rate unchanged as it sought more clarity over lingering economic and political uncertainty, and announced that it will begin offloading exchange-traded funds.
title: BOJ Keeps Rates Steady and Says Will Begin Selling ETFs

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul unveiled his cabinet lineup on Friday, tapping technocrats to head key ministries to steer an economy grappling with the fallout of US tariffs and high household debt.
title: Technocrats Get Key Roles in Thai PM Anutin’s New Cabinet Lineup

author: Yian Lee
description: President Donald Trump has declined to approve a more than $400 million military aid package for Taiwan as he seeks a trade deal with China, according to the Washington Post.
title: Trump Halts $400 Million in Taiwan Military Aid, Post Reports

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un oversaw tests of new combat and reconnaissance drones this week, calling unmanned aerial vehicle development a top-priority for modernizing the country’s armed forces.
title: Kim Jong Un Says Advancing AI for Drones Top Military Priority
